page.title: 06CEREALS
page.content:
{ OIL SEED RAPE}produces from 1]1.5 tonnes per acre. This is harvested by a{combined harvester}and delivered to crushing mills where the oil is extracted and used for example in {margerine}whilst the spent meal may be used for animal feed.
The predominant cereal is{WINTER {WHEAT}sown around October and harvested in August. Some varietes can be milled, to produce flour suitable for{bread}or{biscuit}making. Lower protein wheats are used for animal feeding stuffs. Harvest is a high speed operation, the combine cutting some 50 acres a day and trailors delivering to a{dresser/dryer}in the farm yard where the wheat is stored at 15% moisture.
